newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL palm oil ends steady, but off intra-day high.
newsitem.headline: KL palm oil ends steady, but off intra-day high.

text.p: PALM OIL FUTURE PALM OIL PHYSICAL

PALM OIL FUTURES - Opened lower in tandem due to uncertainty in Chicago soyoil futures. Covering helped midday trade until heavy selling emerged at higher levels. Range-trading followed, with no leads or buying interest from both the domestic and foreign sides. Market expected to stay boxed on Thursday. Aug futures will trade between 1,200 and 1,220.
PALM OIL PHYSICAL- Interest in nearby CPOs and selected oils
At the close, the August futures contract closed two ringgit up at 1,212 ringgit ($484.61) a tonne.
"I expect it'll stay boxed within 1,200-1,220 tomorrow," said dealer, referring to the contract.
Traders said the market was vexed of leads, with the next set of key indictors -- May 1-25 export figures and full-month export numbers -- expected only end of May.
"The market is now depending on day-to-day developments and the direction of physicals," said another trader.
Physicals saw interest ampng nearby CPOs months, traders said.
